entry.title: [gin] Add feature to disable V8 mid-tier regalloc
entry.content:
Prepare launch via Finch by adding a gin feature for disabling the

fallback mid-tier register allocator for huge Wasm functions.

(Right now the mid-tier register allocator is chosen heuristically

only for WebAssembly functions with very many virtual registers.

We want to remove this special case and always use the top-tier

register allocator that produces better code, at the cost of slightly

higher compile time and memory consumption during compilation.)

entry.title: Fix memory management of FuseBoxDaemon.
entry.content:
In its GetInstance(), it keeps the raw ptr in its static local

variable, while it returns scoped_refptr.

When all scoped_refptrs referring the instance are destroyed,

the instance is also destroyed, so the static local pointer will

gets dangling pointer.

Fortunately, we didn't hit the case in production/tests,

but following fix of tests will hit the issue.



This CL initializes/shutdowns explicitly to avoid the case.



BUG=1325210

TEST=Tryjob

entry.title: Update SequenceBound's internal Storage traits to accommodate WeakPtrs
entry.content:
Currently, the Storage traits are written in way that assumes that the

pointer passed to base::BindOnce() is always a native C++ pointer, and

that it is always OK to wrap it in base::Unretained().



However, it would be useful to reuse the SequenceBound implementation

with a WeakPtr: this allows classes to easily perform cross-sequence

calls without having to write their own sequence trampoline. In order to

accommodate that though, any wrapping of pointers for callbacks needs to

be done in the Storage traits itself.



Change-Id: I20258ebe2ee6716edb165a86d2200a4a312f9526

entry.content:

entry.title: Prerender: Add NOTREACHED in OnDidBlockNavigation()
entry.content:
PrerenderWebContentsDelegateImpl::OnDidBlockNavigation() should never be

called during prerendering. Adding NOTREACHED ensures it.



> Details



OnDidBlockNavigation() is called only on the following sequence:



RenderFrameHostImpl::DidBlockNavigation()

--> WebContentsImpl::OnDidBlockNavigation()

--> WebContentsDelegate::OnDidBlockNavigation()



RenderFrameHostImpl::DidBlockNavigation() makes sure it's never called

during prerendering lifecycle state like this:



DCHECK_NE(lifecycle_state(), LifecycleStateImpl::kPrerendering);

delegate_->OnDidBlockNavigation(blocked_url, initiator_url, reason);



Bug: 1350676

Change-Id: Id73bb7b8b2646508f3e38137ca53d9c962e6e66a

entry.title: MR: Fix no keyframe issue when keyframe interval is not specified
entry.content:
The specification states "if both videoKeyFrameIntervalDuration and

videoKeyFrameIntervalCount are null, the User Agent may emit key

frames as it deems fit." This CL fixes the issue that no keyframe

except the first frame is produced with a hardware video encoder.

This CL removes the default keyframes in VpxEncoder and H264Encoder so

that KeyFrameRequestProcessor is only the place of forcing a keyframe.



[1] https://w3c.github.io/mediacapture-record/#mediarecorder-methods

entry.title: Carry over previous document's FrameScheduler's task time on
entry.content:
RenderDocument's LocalFrame <-> LocalFrame swap



When RenderDocument is enabled, same-site cross-document navigations

will create a new LocalFrame instead of reusing the previous

LocalFrame. This means the total task time tracked in the previous

document's FrameSchedulerImpl won't be carried over to the new

document on subframe navigation, which is a regression. This CL makes

it so that the total task time is passed from the previous LocalFrame

to the new LocalFrame, using OldDocumentInfoForCommit.



See also: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4353252/comment/5c2b42b5_387a93fb/



Bug: 936696

entry.title: Simplify lifetime and interaction of various AX JS+Mojo binding classes.
entry.content:
Previously, V8Manager was a refcounted class that was used on two

different threads (the service main thread and a v8 thread specific to

that V8Manager instance). While all interaction with V8 takes place on

the v8 thread, trying to bind a Mojo interface would jump back in a

number of different places:



- the initial configuration of the automation bindings required a jump

back to the main thread to finish setting up the Mojo bindings, since

the Mojo endpoint it used lives on the main thread.

- binding the TTS interface requires a jump back to the main thread, for

the same reason.

- and an in-progress CL for managing focus rings also required a jump

back to the main thread, for the same reason.



Rather than making each InterfaceBinder implementation hop back to the

main thread, it is simpler to hop back to the main thread in only one

place and try to bind the Mojo interface after the thread hop.



To accomplish this, V8Manager has been split out into two classes:



- V8Environment, which encapsulates all the work of directly dealing

with v8. This lives only on the v8 thread now, and is never directly

used from the main thread.

- V8Manager, which owns the V8Environment and is responsible for

proxying any work to it to the v8 thread. It also manages the set of

interface binders that are exposed for that particular V8Environment.



Setting up automation bindings no longer requires a hop back to the main

thread; instead, the V8Manager on the main thread creates pending Mojo

endpoints, which are not sequence-affine, and passes them off to the

V8Environment during construction.



Similarly, binding Mojo interfaces from JS requests now makes one thread

hop from the V8Environment back to the V8Manager, removing the need for

each InterfaceBinder implementation to jump back to the main thread.



This also removes the need to use RefCountedDeleteOnSequence and

refcounting of V8Manager altogether: in fact, RefCountedDeleteOnSequence

is known to be somewhat dangerous, since it is possible to accidentally

bring a to-be-deleted object "back to life" and cause it to be double

deleted.



Finally, this reorganization also uncovered an interesting bug in

OsAccessibilityServiceTest. Configuring an assistive technology

controller always installs the automation JS bindings, which requires a

bound AccessibilityServiceClient remote. However, even though the test

forgot to bind an AccessibilityServiceClient remote, it still passed.

This is because it posted a task back to the main thread to use the

AccessibilityServiceClient remote... but since the task was cancellable

(i.e. it was bound with a WeakPtr), and all the AX objects under test

were destroyed by the time the task run, this omission was never

discovered.



AX-Relnotes: n/a.

entry.title: [Autofill] Add a regex for recognition of 'password' and related words.
entry.content:
In order to improve heuristics of recognizing if a field of HTML type plain text is intended to be a password field, a new regex matches the field's id or name with "password", related words such as "pwd", "passcode" etc. or its most widely used translations.



The translations and words used in the new regex were obtained by using Google translate and checking the usage in a dashboard (https://dashboards.corp.google.com/view/_503fac08_4c6c_4723_af39_eaeae01a4071). Each related word that had much more usage in the password field related type than any other type (plain text) was included in the regex.



TODO: Match more than just name and id (label etc.) and improve the regex template (other words, foreign slangs etc.)





Parent CL: 4693902

entry.title: Use MiraclePtr in SequenceBound storage and fix dangling pointers.
entry.content:
These were not rewritten in the original automated rewrites, since the

automated rewriter did not include type aliases. Using raw_ptr

adds protection against code that incorrectly uses `delete this` in

conjunction with `SequenceBound`.



This also removes the need to annotate the pointer that was already

rewritten to raw_ptr with `AcrossTasksDanglingUntriaged`. This

annotation was previously needed because the storage traits nulled out

the internal pointers in a separate statement after posting the task to

delete the owned object: since the actual deletion takes place on the

owning sequence, it was possible for the deletion to complete on the

owning sequence before the original sequence assigned `nullptr`.



Bug: 1291138

entry.title: Reland "Remove redundant existence check in PathService"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 5ed59357a82db71fc98993f96dd5111411529e36;

see https://crbug.com/1336338#c14 for analysis.



Original change's description:

> Remove redundant existence check in PathService

>

> Callers of PathService::OverrideAndCreateIfNeeded may ask it to ensure

> that the given path exists as a directory. Chrome's

> InitializeUserDataDir uses this to set the path for

> chrome::DIR_USER_DATA on the basis of command line or enterprise policy

> options. Since base::CreateDirectory itself will return true if the

> given path already exists as a directory, and will return false if the

> given path either names a file or such a directory cannot be created,

> there is no need for OverrideAndCreateIfNeeded to make any checks on the

> path before calling CreateDirectory. Doing so is only wasted I/O and can

> lead to filesystem races.

>

> Bug: 1336338

> Change-Id: If0b910f90ce5d89af56731edd6fb7d0787124a6d

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685555

> Reviewed-by: Francois Pierre Doray

> Commit-Queue: Francois Pierre Doray

> Auto-Submit: Greg Thompson

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1175536}



Bug: 1336338

Change-Id: Ia82743cfed5bcd1622544e8b86de9380643509e7

entry.title: Revert "crosier: Add base class InteractiveAshTest for ash-chrome tests"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 43fab0393e01c47a3e75f14357b44ca41af8c1d5.



Reason for revert: This Cl seems to be the cause of InteractiveAshTestUITest.Basics keep failing on Linux Chromium OS ASan LSan Tests (1), starting from https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Chromium%20OS%20ASan%20LSan%20Tests%20(1)/52659/overview



Original change's description:

> crosier: Add base class InteractiveAshTest for ash-chrome tests

>

> Base class for tests of ash-chrome integration with the ChromeOS

> platform, like hardware daemons, graphics, kernel, etc.

>

> Sets up Kombucha for ash testing:

> - Provides 1 Kombucha "context" per display, shared by all

> views::Widgets

> - Provides a default "context widget" so Kombucha can synthesize mouse

> events

> - Suppresses creating a browser window on startup, because most

> ash-chrome tests don't need the window and creating it slows down

> the test

>

> Tests using this base class can be added to "chromeos_integration_tests"

> to run on devices under test (DUTs) and virtual machines (VMs). Also, if

> a test only communicates with OS daemons via D-Bus then the test can

> also run in the linux-chromeos "emulator" in "interactive_ui_tests". The

> latter approach makes it simpler to write the initial version of a test,

> which can then be added to "chromeos_integration_tests" to also run on

> DUT/VM.

>

> Because this class derives from InProcessBrowserTest the source files

> must be added to a target that defines HAS_OUT_OF_PROC_TEST_RUNNER. The

> source files cannot be in a shared test support target that lacks that

> define.

>

> Bug: b:291732302

> Test: interactive_ui_tests --gtest_filter=InteractiveAshTestUITest.Basics

> Test: out_betty/Release/run_chromeos_integration_tests # VM

> Test: out_dedede/Release/run_chromeos_integration_tests # DUT

> Change-Id: Ia27b95e761ebd3cfbb91c621072619a410f99a36

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4730306

entry.title: [SBv5] Rename variables and functions in API handler to make it more extensible
entry.content:
To support SBv5, SafeBrowsingApiHandlerBridge will be extended in two

ways:

* It will handle both hash database check and hash prefix real

time check.

* It will handle calls to both SafetyNet API and SafeBrowsing API.



Rename some variables and functions that can be confusing. For example,

rename sHandler to sSafetyNetApiHandler and rename setHandler to

setSafetyNetApiHandler since there will be two handlers in the future:

one for SafetyNet and one for SafeBrowsing. Rename StartURLCheck to

StartHashDatabaseUrlCheck since it will also handle hash prefix real

time check in the future.



Also remove an unused histogram enum UmaThreatSubType.



Pure refactoring CL, no behavioral change.



Bug: 1444511

checked whether the test is doable on Android individually for each

function of |PrerenderEagernessBrowserTest|.

self-contained.

entry.title: Revert "Fix coordinate transforms and clean up menu_controller_unittest.cc."
entry.content:
This reverts commit ce20a9ec539dc5b8df0d97a264267f477dbd74b9.



Reason for revert: This Cl is possibly the cause for a lot of MenuControllerTest.AsynchronousGestureDeletesController failures on multiple mac builders (e.g. for mac 13: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fui%2Fviews%3Aviews_unittests%2FMenuControllerTest.AsynchronousGestureDeletesController?q=V%3Aos%3DMac-13+V%3Atest_suite%3Dviews_unittests+), e.g.: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/b/8774003224362389681, https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/mac12-arm64-rel-tests/10758/overview

the test seems be failing mostly consistent but also passing rarely, so it is probably flaky but not always fail



Original change's description:

> Fix coordinate transforms and clean up menu_controller_unittest.cc.

>

> MenuController event handlers expect the coordinates of provided events

> to be in the scroll view container coordinate system (a.k.a. the submenu

> root view). Some tests complied with this, others did not. Fix all of

> them to be the same.

>

> One test was also failing on Win 11 (and, soon, on other platforms)

> because using bubble menus with corner radii resulted in exceeding the

> hardcoded size reserved for the menu. Configure this dynamically

> instead.

>

> This finally cleans up various other things, e.g. lack of

> make_unique<>(), type repetition, etc.

>

> Bug: 1286137

> Change-Id: Ib00b109442f9b7f840075e255c0991ff83e22884

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1177533}

entry.title: Allow urlPattern field to take URLPatternInit.
entry.content:
This is something told in:

https://github.com/yoshisatoyanagisawa/service-worker-static-routing-api/blob/main/final-form.md



To allow people to write a complex pattern and make URLPattern

understand it, let me make URLPatternInit also supported.

With this way, people can write like:



condition: {

urlPattern: new URLPattern("*://example.com/*.ico")

}



With this change, we also changed the string URLPattern behavior.

It used to be thought as the pathname URL pattern.

i.e. equivalent behavior to:

URLPattern({pathname: ""}).

However, now it silently sets the ServiceWorker script's base URL

as the base URL.

i.e. URLPattern({pathname: ""},

entry.title: [win] Replace GetChromeInstallPath with simpler primitives
entry.content:
GetChromeInstallPath returned the path to a currently-installed Chrome

or, if one was not found, the default install path. Many of its callers

only care about the path to an existing install, and don't want the path

if Chrome isn't installed. In this CL, we split GetChromeInstallPath

into GetInstalledDirectory, which returns a path to an existing

installation or an empty path, and GetDefaultChromeInstallPath, which

returns the default path and CHECKs if this is not possible.



This CL also simplifies the logic in CanUpdateCurrentChrome. Previously,

it would compare the current browser's install directory to the current

or default install directory for both per-user and per-machine

installs. Since Google Update will only update one or the other, it

suffices to only check against the currently-installed browser at the

current level (per-user or per-machine).



In combination, these changes should resove two potential crashes:



1. CanUpdateCurrentChrome could have crashed when looking for the

"other" install level's directory. For example, if the PathService

cannot resolve DIR_PROGRAM_FILES and the PROGRAMFILES environment

variable is not set.



2. CheckMachineLevelInstall could have crashed when looking for a

per-user install's directory if there was no per-user install and the

PathService couldn't resolve DIR_LOCAL_APP_DATA and the LOCALAPPDATA

environment variable was not set.



Bug: 1467740

Change-Id: I65acfe547dcc8045edb1fa7e187aed003d8f2848

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4732972

entry.title: Prerender: Separate the number limit of speculation rules by eagerness
entry.content:
Before this CL, PrerenderHostRegistry had a limit on the maximum number

of running prerenders for embedder and speculation rules, respectively.



This CL further separates the number limit of speculation rules into

following two categories by eagerness:

- Eager(eager), which are triggered immediately after adding the rule.

- Non-eager(moderate, conservative), which wait for a specific user

action to trigger.

and applies the appropriate corresponding limits per these

attributes(currently sets to 10 and 2, respectively).



Please see the design doc on crbug for more information.



Bug: 1464021

Change-Id: I9b78b379eec33f4392d75aedba6f37aa1742126e

entry.title: Revert "bluetooth: Always include bonded devices in UI"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 014c273fb7917159c92196e574c85d4955ea089b.



Reason for revert: b/293949690, breaks browser_tests --gtest_filter="DeviceEventLogErrorBrowserTest.LoginUser"



Original change's description:

> bluetooth: Always include bonded devices in UI

>

> This change updates the logic that determines whether a Bluetooth device

> is supported to automatically treat bonded devics as supported,

> regardless of whether the type of the device would have been supported

> had it not been bonded.

entry.title: Return PiP to original position after notification dismissal
entry.content:
Picture in Picture windows are moved aside if a new popup

notificatin window shows up in a space that overlaps the PiP

window. However, the PiP window did not return to its original

position even after the popup notification window was dismissed

and destroyed.



This commit fixes four issues with the code to properly return

the PiP window position to its original position after the popup

notification window is dismissed.



1. Upon popup notification window destruction, no execution path

that went to WindowState::UpdatePipBounds existed. Now,

WorkspaceLayoutManager calls NotifySystemUiAreaChanged when

OnWindowDestroying is called for the popup notifacion window,

recalculating and updating the PiP window bounds.



2. Bounds calculations are done in CollisionDetectionUtils, which

did not take into account whether a window is under destruction.

This resulted in an incorrect bounds calculation when called from

OnWindowDestroying since the destroyed window still existed. This

also has been updated.



3. During shutdown the pointer for CaptureModeController is

destroyed before the windows are destroyed with

OnWindowDestroying. This is a required behaviour, but with this

calling NotifySystemUiAreaChanged in OnWindowDestroying results in

a crash. Now, it has been updated so that FloatingWindowObserver

is destroyed upon OnShellDestroying, making sure that

OnWindowDestroying is not called during shutdown.



4. SnapFraction, which dictates the position of the PiP window,

was not set when a new PiP window was created. Now, this value is

set when OnWindowVisibilityChanged is called, which ensures that

this value is set when the PiP window is first created.

OnWindowVisibilityChanged was used instead of OnPostPipStateChange

because when OnPostPipStateChange is called the PiP bounds are not

yet set.



Bug: b/286602636

Test: Manually verified that the PiP returns to original position

Change-Id: Iefb505f00ef465932e4c821f85c8b4e05c40246b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4713908

Commit-Queue: Masayuki Fujita

Reviewed-by: Sammie Quon

Auto-Submit: Masayuki Fujita

entry.title: Fix DriveUploadHandlerTest test flakes
entry.content:
NetworkChangeNotifier always sends CONNECTION_NONE before the it sends

an online state; this can race with the test code at the start of the

test, causing the Drive upload operation to fail. Setting the notifier

to send test notifications only prevents this CONNECTION_NONE state

from being sent, which should prevent this race.



Bug: 1468492, b:275977911

entry.title: graphite: Specify BGRA explicitly for OffscreenCanvas WebGL
entry.content:
OffscreenCanvas disables the use of IOSurface backed GMB for WebGL

DrawingBuffer, but with Graphite IOSurfaces are used without GMB or

scanout usage since that's the only way to share textures between WebGL

on ANGLE and Graphite on Dawn.



The RGBA vs BGRA distinction matters for Graphite, so we explicitly use

BGRA on the GMB path, but we're still allowing RGBA on the non-GMB

path. The OS compositor doesn't like RGBA IOSurfaces so we should

explicitly use BGRA in the non-GMB path too. This CL does that by moving

the RGBA to BGRA override outside the ShouldUseImageChromium() branch.



Bug: 1466806

Change-Id: I33fff4c65ea23784155af39481e1e5f95fb15e1b
